Containers.Description: Jellyfin is The Free Software Media Browser. Converted By Community Applications. Always verify this template (and values) against the Docker Hub support page for the container! [br][br] You can add as many mount points as needed for recordings, movies, etc. [br][br] [b][span style='color: #E80000;']Directions:[/span][/b][br] [b]/config[/b]: This is where Jellyfin will store its databases and configuration. [br][br] [b]Port[/b]: This is the default port for Jellyfin. SSL support can be added manually. [br][br] [b]Media[/b]: This is the mount point for your media. In Jellyfin, it will appear as `/media` or a custom mount point. [br][br] [b]Cache[/b]: This is where Jellyfin will manage cached files such as images. This is separate from your media storage. [br][br] [b]Tip:[/b] Add more volume mappings if you want Jellyfin to access additional resources. [br][br]
Containers.Overview: Jellyfin Server is a home media server built on top of popular open-source technologies. It is completely free and community-driven.
